member.name: ID3D11DeviceContext3.Flush1
member.summary: Sends queued-up commands in the command buffer to the graphics processing unit (GPU), with a specified context type and an optional event handle to create an event query.
member.param: A that specifies the context in which a query occurs, such as a 3D command queue, 3D compute queue, 3D copy queue, video, or image.

param.name: hEvent
param.para: An optional event handle. When specified, this method creates an event query.

Flush1 operates asynchronously, therefore it can return either before or after the GPU finishes executing the queued graphics commands, which will eventually complete. To create an event query, you can call with the value value. To determine when the GPU is finished processing the graphics commands, you can then use that event query in a call to .
